sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
    1——2——3    
    |\    |    
    | \   |    
    |  \  |    
    4——5——6    
```

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in the graph.
message_2:
A cut vertex (also known as an articulation point) is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

In the given graph, the cut vertices are:
- Vertex 2: If we remove vertex 2, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 4, 5} and {3, 6}.
- Vertex 5: If we remove vertex 5, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3} and {4, 6}.

The bridges in the graph are:
- Edge (2, 3): If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 4, 5} and {3, 6}.
- Edge (4, 5): If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3, 6} and {4, 5}.
- Edge (5, 6): If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and {6}.
